page.title: 07Houses in Stanground
page.content: The housing in Stanground is in two main areas;to the north and south of the main Peterbough to Whittlesey Road.To the south is the Oakdale Estate which was begun in the late 1950's when the area began to be developed to provide homes in the expanding city of{Peterborough}.Houses on this estate are mainly semi-detached with a few detached houses and bungalows.All are privately owned,and in 1985 may be purchased for between Â£20.000 and Â£30,000. To the north is a large council estate consisting of terraced houses,semi-detached dwellings and some flats.These houses were begun as developments after the war,and the estate has been added to throughout the 1960's and 1970's.The council estate is adjoined by private housing on the Park Farm Estate.
